{{more citations needed|date=March 2018}} {{Infobox comedian <!-- for individuals - see Template:Infobox comedian for usage --> | name = James Adomian | image = James Adomian (9336863913).jpg | image_size = | alt = | caption = Adomian in 2013 | pseudonym = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1980|1|31}} | birth_place = [[Omaha, Nebraska]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | medium = Stand-up comedy, television | education = | alma_mater = | active = 2005â€“present | genre = | subject = | spouse = | domesticpartner = | children = | parents = | relatives = | notable_work = | memorials = | signature = | website = {{URL|http://jamesadomian.com}} | footnotes = | module = }}
'''James Adomian''' (born January 31, 1980) is an [[United States|American]] stand-up comedian, actor, and impressionist. He is best known for his work on ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'', ''[[Chapo Trap House]]'', ''[[Last Comic Standing]]'', ''[[The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson]]'' where he [[Impressionist (entertainment)|impersonated]] President [[George W. Bush]] until 2009, and for portraying [[Bernie Sanders]] during the 2016 [[Trump vs. Bernie]] tour. He voices Talking Ben in the ''[[Talking Tom and Friends]]'' animated series.
==Early life== Adomian was born [[Omaha, Nebraska]] on January 31, 1980 and raised in [[Atlanta]], [[Georgia (U.S. state)|Georgia]]. His family moved to [[Los Angeles]], when he was ten years old.<ref>[https://www.timeout.com/chicago/comedy/james-adomian ''James Adomian: An up-and-comer hits the Lodge.], timeout.com, October 4, 2011</ref> Adomian is an alumnus of [[Los Angeles Baptist High School]] and attended [[Whittier College]] studying in a self-designed major in Economics and Theatre Arts.<ref>[http://www.whittier.edu/alumni/notable-entertainment Notable Whittier College Alumni: Entertainment, Arts & Literature], whittier.edu</ref> He notes that he did not graduate during a 2017 interview with Pete Holmes.<ref>https://nerdist.com/you-made-it-weird-387-james-adomian/</ref> Adomian is of [[Armenia]]n descent.<ref>[http://www.serialoptimist.com/interviews/the-always-funny-fresh-to-death-james-adomian-16120.html ''The always funny & fresh to death James Adomian''], 8 May 2013</ref>
==Career== In 2012, Adomian appeared on ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang! (TV series)|Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'' as [[PBS]] broadcaster [[Huell Howser]], on [[Adult Swim]]'s ''[[Childrens Hospital]]'' as [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]] and on [[MTV]]'s ''Money from Strangers'' as himself, also making regular appearances as various sketch characters on ''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]''.
In 2011, he was cast as a co-lead in the un-aired [[Kari Lizer]] pilot project for [[NBC]] alongside [[Sarah Paulson]] and [[Tim Meadows]].
In summer 2010, he appeared on NBC's ''[[Last Comic Standing]]'' as a top-ten finalist, and also starred in the un-aired ''Krog'' pilot for [[Cartoon Network]].
Adomian began appearing as President George W. Bush frequently on ''[[The Late Late Show (CBS TV series)|The Late Late Show]]'' after [[Craig Ferguson]] took over hosting the show in January 2005 until 2009.
He has appeared on several other comedy programs, including ''[[Mad TV|MADtv]]'', ''[[Mind of Mencia]]'', ''[[Jimmy Kimmel Live!]]'', ''[[Nick Cannon Presents: Short Circuitz|Short Circuitz]]'', ''[[Atom TV]]'', ''[[Cavemen (TV series)|Cavemen]]'', ''[[Recount (film)|Recount]]'' and ''[[Players (2010 TV series)|Players]]''.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1894391/|title=James Adomian|website=IMDb|access-date=2018-02-01}}</ref>
Adomian has appeared in the films ''[[Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay]]'' and ''[[Miss March]]''.
As a [[voice-over]] artist, Adomian performed on ''[[The Onion|The Onion Radio News]]'', as several recurring characters on the PBS cartoon series ''[[WordGirl]]'', as President Bush on a few episodes of ''[[Mad TV|MADtv]]'', as [[Jimmy Kimmel]] on ''[[Celebrity Deathmatch]]'', and on a number of other cartoons.
===Stand-up comedy album=== In 2012, Adomian released his debut comedy album ''Low Hangin Fruit''. The release was the first album released by [[Earwolf]], and received mostly positive reviews.<ref>{{cite web|last=Wenzel|first=John|title=James Adomian Low Hangin Fruit album review|url=http://www.thespittake.com/2012/08/13/james-adomian-low-hangin-fruit-earwolf/|publisher=The Spit Take|accessdate=10 April 2013}}</ref> The one-hour stand-up set features personal stories, a number of celebrity impressions and political material including observations regarding the cultural perceptions of [[LGBT]] people.
===Live appearances=== [[File:James Adomian & Anthony Atamanuik by Gage Skidmore.jpg|right|thumb|James Adomian (''right'') performing as [[Bernie Sanders]], along with [[Anthony Atamanuik]] as [[Donald Trump]] at Politicon in Pasadena, California.]] Adomian frequently performs live at [[Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre]] in sketch and stand-up shows such as ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang!]]'', ''Who Charted?'', and many others. He is also an alumnus of the Sunday Company at [[The Groundlings]] Theatre, where he still frequently performs. He also regularly performs at "The Tomorrow Show" and other stand-up shows in Hollywood. Adomian is known for doing many [[Impressionist (entertainment)|impression]]s at live shows, both in-costume and as part of his standup act, including [[Vincent Price]], [[Lewis Black]], [[Orson Welles]], [[Jesse Ventura]], [[Paul Giamatti]], [[Michael Caine]], [[Philip Seymour Hoffman]], [[Sam Elliott]], [[Al Franken]], [[Huell Howser]], [[Christopher Hitchens]], [[Gary Busey]], [[John McCain]], [[Joe Lieberman]], [[Marc Maron]], [[Jimmy Kimmel]], [[Andy Kindler]], [[Tom Leykis]], [[Todd Glass]], [[George W. Bush]], and [[Bernie Sanders]]. He has performed several impressions as recurring characters on ''[[Comedy Bang! Bang!]]''<ref> {{cite web|url=http://www.earwolf.com/guest/jamesadomian/|title=James Adomian on Earwolf|publisher=[[Comedy Bang! Bang!]]|accessdate=2013-10-07}}</ref>
Adomian often makes live appearances around the country doing standup or characters, particularly at [[Left-wing politics|left-wing]] political events like [[Netroots Nation|YearlyKos]], [[Living Liberally|Laughing Liberally]], the [[Free Press (organization)|National Conference for Media Reform]] and campaign events for Congressman [[Alan Grayson]]. In 2010, he made several live standup appearances across North America in the Breaking Even tour.{{citation needed|date=January 2012}}
In 2008, he appeared with comedian [[Greg Giraldo]] at venues around the country as part of the Indecision '08 Tour produced by [[Comedy Central]]. He has performed at [[comedy festival]]s across North America, including [[Just for Laughs]] in [[Montreal]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://jamesadomian.com/category/just-for-laughs/|title=Just for Laughs {{!}} James Adomian|website=jamesadomian.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-02-01}}</ref> In March 2012, Adomian had his first overseas appearance, headlining a sell-out two night show in [[Seoul]], [[South Korea]] for [[Stand Up Seoul]].<ref> {{cite web|last=MacDonald|first=Hamish|title=James Adomian brings the funny to Seoul|url=http://www.koreaherald.com/lifestyle/Detail.jsp?newsMLId=20120228001183|publisher=[[The Korea Herald]]|accessdate=2012-03-05}}</ref>
Adomian toured the US with the Trump v. Bernie tour in Februaryâ€“March 2016.
==Personal life== Adomian is openly [[gay]].<ref>{{cite web|last=McKee|first=Ryan|title=How to Improve 'Last Comic Standing': Bring Back The House!|url=http://www.tvsquad.com/2010/07/19/last-comic-standing-needs-to-bring-back-the-house/|publisher=[[Weblogs, Inc.|TV Squad]]|accessdate=2011-02-24}} - "When James Adomian performs, it's more exciting if you know he could be the first gay comic to win 'LCS.' Wait, you didn't even know he's gay? My point exactly. Bring back the house."</ref> He is the grandson of Armenian-American mathematician [[George Adomian]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://probablyscience.libsyn.com/webpage/episode-017-james-adomian |title=Probably Science : Episode 017 - James Adomian |publisher=[[Probably Science|Probablyscience]].libsyn.com |date=2012-04-23 |accessdate=2014-03-08}}</ref>
